general.address: 70 Lincoln Center Plaza, New York, NY 10023, United States

eligibilityCriteria.criteria: Films with a running time of 40 minutes or less.
Feature-length works curated by the NYFF selection committee.

fees.feeDetails: Curated by the selection committee, no open submission fees.

festivalInfo.description: The New York Film Festival (NYFF) is one of the most prestigious and long-running film festivals in the world, held annually in New York City. Founded in 1963, it presents a curated selection of films, showcasing both established filmmakers and emerging voices. The festival includes feature films, documentaries, and shorts, with a focus on artistic excellence and innovation in cinema. NYFF is known for its selective programming, attracting filmmakers, critics, and cinephiles alike. It serves as a major platform for films looking to make an impact during awards season.
festivalInfo.name: New York Film Festival

shortFilm.conditions: Films must be New York City premieres and not previously available on home entertainment platforms.

featureFilm.conditions: Curated by the NYFF selection committee. Must be New York City premieres.

submissionDetails.entryRequirements: Films must be New York City premieres.

submissionDetails.fees: No open submission process for feature films.
submissionDetails.submissionDetails: Films curated by the selection committee.
